materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ or Caron® Simply Soft Brights™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) in Neon Pink (39775) or Iris (39747) or Super Duper Yellow (B9612) or Limelight (B9607) or Blue Mint (B9608) - 1 ball or 68 yds/62 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Standard elastic hair ties approx 1½" [4 cm] diameter
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® Split-lock stitch count markers
measurements: To cover standard hair tie, approx 1½" [4 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Notes:
• Scrunchie is worked in a continuous spiral around elastic hair tie.
• To keep track of rounds (rnds), place a stitch marker in the 1st stitch of each rnd.
Chain (ch) 13. Wrap chain around elastic hair tie and then join chain with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch to form ring, being careful to not twist chain.
1st round (rnd): Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in first ch. 1 sc in each ch around. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). 13 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Working around elastic hair tie, repeat (rep) last rnd 61 times more. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. 63 rnds total.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, sew first and last rnds together (tog) with a flat seam.

pattern_name: Put a Bow On It Crochet Hair Clip
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Light Sage (0631) or Delft Blue (0885) or Light Raspberry (0774)
1 ball or 45 yds/41 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® open ring stitch markers.
3 hair clips approx 3" [7.5 cm] wide.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] wide x 4½" [11.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
BOW
Ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc. Place marker at end of last row.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape front of Bow as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc. Place marker at end of last row. 8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 8th row until work from last marked row measures 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
TIE
Ch 9.
1st row: 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 hdc. Fasten off.
Wrap Tie around Bow as shown in photo. Join first st to last st of row to secure Tie.
LEFT TAIL
Ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 11 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row. 13 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last sc. 3 sc in last sc. Work 3 sc evenly along shaped edge of Tail. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, work 3 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Fasten off.
RIGHT TAIL
Ch 10.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 11 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
4th row: (RS). As 2nd row. 13 sc. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first unworked loop of foundation ch.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Work 3 sc evenly along shaped edge of tail. 3 sc in last st of 4th row. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Tails to WS of Bow. Hot glue Bow to hair clip.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Bright Pink (12042) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
1 hard headband ½" [1.5 cm] wide.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Heart Motif = Approx 5½" [14 cm] wide after assembly.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

Heart Motif (make 4)
Ch 9.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn.
Fasten off.

Headband Casing
Ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Casing measures length to fit Headband. Do not fasten off at end of last row.

Join sides
With WS tog, fold Casing in half lengthwise.
Joining row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses to join, work 1 row of sc evenly down long side edge of Casing to bottom. Fasten off leaving a long tail. With tail, sew bottom of Casing closed.
Insert Headband into Casing. Sew top end closed.

Assembly
Heart Muffs
With 2 Heart Motifs, WS tog, join yarn with sl st to bottom point of Heart Motifs, working through both thicknesses.
Joining rnd: (RS) Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 7 sc across long edge to top of Heart. Work 4 sc across top of Heart. Work 2 sc to center of Heart. Sc2tog over last sc of side just worked and next side. Work 2 sc to next top edge. Work 4 sc across top of Heart. Do not fasten off. Pull long loop to secure final loop, then proceed with stuffing.

Stuffing
Using leftover yarn, wrap around 3 fingers 15 times. Trim yarn, leaving a long tail, and slide wraps off fingers. Using the tail, tie around yarn to create stuffing ‘bundle’. Stuff Heart Muff with 2 yarn bundles before completing joining rnd.

Cont rnd as follows: Work 8 sc across rem long edge of Heart Motif. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep with rem 2 Heart Motifs. Weave in ends.
Sew Heart Muffs to either end of Headband, having end of Headband approx 1" [2.5 cm] down from center of Heart, as shown in diagram, ensuring Heart Muff is RS out.

materials: Red Heart® Unforgettable™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 119 yds/109 m) Candied (3965) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops.
measurements: Approx 46” [117 cm] long x 3” [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 20 sts and 21 rows = 4” [10 cm] in sc/ch-1 (Moss st) pat.
instructions:
Ch 2. (See Diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sts - 3 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts – 4 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. 6 sts – 4 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts – 5 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sts – 5 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sts – 6 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows twice more, inc 1 st at end of every RS row. 13 sts at end of last row. Place marker on last row on RS of work.
Work even in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from marked row measures 41” [104 cm], ending on a WS.
Beg Dec’s:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 3 times more to 5 sts, then rep 1st and 2nd rows once more. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Fashion 3 (150 yds/147m) Atom Red (2160) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
Elastic hairband
12" [30.5 cm] length of sewing thread
For Beaded Scrunchie only: Sewing thread in contrasting color
24 size 6/0 or E glass Rochelle beads
abbreviations: PB (place bead) = Cut 12" [30.5 cm] length of sewing thread. Fold length in half and knot two ends tog making a larger than average knot. Drop crochet loop from hook, insert sewing needle through dropped loop and back through thread loop. Place bead on needle and draw crochet loop through bead. Pull on sewing thread knot and remove from crochet thread. Place dropped crochet loop back on hook.
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
measurements: Scrunchie inside diameters measures same as elastic hairband.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project. Use recommended hook or hook size needed to make medium/tight stitches.
instructions:
Notes:
• Each Scrunchie is worked in joined rnds.
• 1st rnd is worked over top of elastic hairband using Covering-sc.

SCRUNCHIE #1 (Beaded Scrunchie)
See chart on page 3.
Make an adjustable ring.
1st rnd: Place slip knot on hook (1 loop on hook). Take working yarn over top of elastic hairband to back. Yoh and draw up a loop inserting hook from front to back through center of hairband (2 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through both loops on hook- covering-sc made. 2 covering-sc. Picot. (5 covering-sc. Picot) 11 times. 2 covering-sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 picot and 60 sc (12 groups of 5-sc).
2nd rnd: [Ch 6. PB. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 4. Skip next picot and 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc (3rd sc of 5-sc group). Skip next 2 sc] 12 times. 12 sc and 12 beaded petals.
3rd rnd: (Ch 8. PB. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 6. Sl st in next sc between petals) 12 times. Fasten off.

SCRUNCHIE #2 (Hearts over Hearts Scrunchie)
See chart on page 3.
1st rnd: Place slip knot on hook. 60 covering-sc over an elastic hairband. Join with sl st in first sc. 60 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 8 (counts as dc and ch 5). Skip first 5 sc. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 5. Skip next 5 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Ch 5. Skip last 5 sc. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch-8. 10 dc and 10 ch-5 sps.
3rd rnd: Ch 9 (counts as tr and ch 5). 3-tr Cl in same sp as sl st. *Skip next ch-5 sp. (3-tr Cl. Ch 5. 3-tr Cl) in next dc. Rep from * to last ch-5 sp. Skip last ch-5 sp. 2-tr Cl in same sp as first 3-tr Cl. Join with sl st in 4th ch of beg ch-9. 10 cluster pairs (hearts).
4th rnd: * Ch 3. (3-dc Cl. Ch 3. 3-dc Cl) in 3rd ch of next ch-5. Ch 3. 1 sc in next sp between hearts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in base of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
